messages.message: Hi David, it's time for your weekly check-in. How has your glucose management been over the last few days?
It's been a successful week. I've been really focused on my pre-bolusing and trying to match my insulin curve to my food absorption. Things feel very controlled.
That's great to hear you're being so proactive. Can you log your fasting levels from the weekend?
Sure. Saturday was 125 mg/dL, Sunday was 118 mg/dL, and this morning was 122 mg/dL. A little higher than I'd like, but right in that target pocket before dawn phenomenon kicks in. No major spikes.
Those are steady numbers. And how has your diet been? Have you been able to stick to your carb targets?
Yes, carb counting has been precise. I always weigh my food to make sure the grams are exact. You have to be diligent about it.
Hi David, I've received a glucose alert from your sensor, showing a reading of 280 mg/dL. Are you okay?

Yes, I'm fine. I'm handling it. It's a bit of a fluke, to be honest. I had some brown rice with dinner, which I know can be tricky. It's a low-glycemic index food, so the carbs release much slower than you'd expect. I think my initial bolus was timed for a faster-acting carb, so my insulin peaked before the glucose really started to rise. Now I'm just playing catch-up with a correction dose. It's a classic timing mismatch, happens to everyone.
I understand, timing complex carbs can be difficult. Did you have anything else with the meal?
Just the usual chicken and broccoli. The variable was the rice. I'll probably switch back to quinoa, it's more predictable for me.
Okay, David. Keep a close eye on your levels as your correction dose starts to work. Let me know if you need further assistance.
Hi David, welcome to your weekly check-in. How are things?
Much better. I learned my lesson from that spike last week. I've been very careful.
I'm glad to hear that. Reviewing your log, you mentioned the spike on Thursday was due to a timing mismatch with a slow-releasing carb. Do you feel more confident in managing that now?

Oh, Thursday? Yeah, that was a tough one. It was my friend's birthday and I had a slice of cake. I took a pretty big bolus for it, but the high sugar and fat content really delayed the glucose absorption. I should have done an extended bolus over an hour or two instead of all at once. My mistake.
Thank you for clarifying. Your log from Thursday mentioned the meal was brown rice, chicken, and broccoli. It's helpful to have the correct information to better understand these events.
Right. Yeah, it was a busy day.
